intro: Sisyrolepis, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. The plants are shrubs or small trees, often growing on rocky soils and in dry environments. Sisyrolepis species are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. They play an important ecological role in their native habitats, providing food and shelter for various wildlife.
